Articles.Content:
Does the discovery pod have an IVA...?

I can check for you.

EDIT: The pod uses the same IVA as the stock Mk3 pod, so whatever you have as that IVA, will be in the Discovery pod.

Edited August 26, 2014 by Jaxx

As a sidenote, does anyone know how to make the rocket fuel cap compatible with Modular Fuel Tanks? It's basically the only thing missing from this (other than part balancing which I don't really care about).

As a sidenote, does anyone know how to make the rocket fuel cap compatible with Modular Fuel Tanks? It's basically the only thing missing from this (other than part balancing which I don't really care about).

Anyone at all? Along with a hopeful bump that the author might come back sometime...
Use Procedural Parts and make your own.

I am trying to add the scale function to the "pod" that is the docking ring with flight computer and RCS built in. I would like to scale it to fit any size stack. however I use module manager to add the tweakscale module, or the goodspeedtweakscale module, but neither of them seem to work. I get no scale sliders in the vehicle assembly area. any ideas?

S

Never mind I just realized scaling it will not help. it is a docking port Sr. and just scaling it to normal docking port size graphically will not allow it to connect. the game code has internal "size" values and the rescaled part will still be telling KSP it is the larger size.

Edited September 25, 2014 by Bit Fiddler

So, .25.....

I don't know for sure (haven't investigated yet) but it seems at first flush that Squad may have moved the locations of the stock textures. Goodspeed, as I understand it, use the stock textures, and the parts are now mostly just blue.

So, .25.....

I don't know for sure (haven't investigated yet) but it seems at first flush that Squad may have moved the locations of the stock textures. Goodspeed, as I understand it, use the stock textures, and the parts are now mostly just blue.

Gaius hasn't been around for a long while. We may need to remap the textures ourselves. Let's see if the license allows us to help out.
I already rewrote the part.cfgs to match the new folder structure and sent him the link. I don't know if he comes back and if not, I'm not sure if i can post those configs. Any advice?

I already rewrote the part.cfgs to match the new folder structure and sent him the link. I don't know if he comes back and if not, I'm not sure if i can post those configs. Any advice?

check the licence or make a MM patch would be my sugestion

I already rewrote the part.cfgs to match the new folder structure...

Awesome! Thanks, ximrm! Echoing dtoxic, my pref would be a MM patch.

Reading his license link on the OP, it appears you are allowed to remix, transform or build upon according to the Creative Commons license

So you just need to attribute Gaius, don't sell it, and use the same Creative Commons license: and then you are free to share.
Do the new cfgs include rebalanced costs, cause that would be great!

Ok, here are the configs, I added the license to the .rar.

I have only changed the some lines to match the new folder structure so (squad-)textures and models can load.

It seems to work fine.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/97sebh9k89e6kvi/Goodspeed-tex-configs.rar?dl=0

All credit goes to Gaius.

Edited October 9, 2014 by ximrm
ximrm, you da man. Thanks a bunch!

I thought it might be nice to have the updated .25 configs in Module Manager patch form, so I made one based on ximrm's configs. You can grab Goodspeed.25Patch.cfg from my Dropbox. Enjoy!

Much thanks to ximrm for doing the tedious part, tracking down to where the models and textures had been moved.

Edited October 14, 2014 by wreckreation
update the dropbox url

@wreckreation: Love the idea; there is a slight typo, easily fixed in two of the docking ports:

@PART[goodspeedDockingPort2iJr] {

@MODEL,0 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPortJr/model

}

@MODEL,0 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/spotLightMk2/model

}

}

@PART[goodspeedDockingPort2iSr] {

@MODEL,0 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPortSr/model

}

@MODEL,0 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/spotLightMk2/model

}

}

should be:

@PART[goodspeedDockingPort2iJr] {

@MODEL,0 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPortJr/model

}

@MODEL,1 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/spotLightMk2/model

}

}

@PART[goodspeedDockingPort2iSr] {

@MODEL,0 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPortSr/model

}

@MODEL,1 {

@model = Squad/Parts/Utility/spotLightMk2/model

}

}

(Otherwise these two parts look like the standard lights in VAB and don't work.)

Indeed that is a typo. It'd be rather silly to give a docking port the model for a spotlight. Thanks for catching that, odmonk!

Typo is fixed and patch updated: Goodspeed.25Patch.zip

Edited October 21, 2014 by wreckreation
patch url

Hey, I keep getting blue textures on a lot of your items, did I not do something correctly?

Use the Module Manager fix in the post above yours.

Or download the fixed parts from Post #163

Typo is fixed and patch updated: Goodspeed.25Patch.zip

where exactly do i put this patch file???
It is a module manager patch, so anywhere in gamedata will work, so long as you have the modmanager.dll as well.

where exactly do i put this patch file???

Elaborating just a bit on what Shania_L said above:

First you need Module Manager. It allows parts to be modified on the fly, as the game loads.

Then unzip the Goodspeed patch into the GameData folder that's in the Kerbal Space Program folder. If you downloaded KSP directly, it might be e.g. C:\Kerbal Space Program\GameData. If you downloaded it through Steam, it might be e.g. G:\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData.

Voila!

Yes i already have module manager and I've tried putting the patch.cfg in KSP/GameData/Goodspeed folder and also just into the KSP/GameData and both attempts seem to have no effect. am i still doing something wrong?? and thanks for the help btw.

- - - Updated - - -

Nevermind! i got it working sorry to bother you.

Nevermind! i got it working sorry to bother you.

Nice job keeping these parts useable, some of my favorites.
